title: 109_hr2134
content: The Act titled "Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of American Latino Heritage Act of 2006" establishes a commission. The Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of American Latino Heritage consists of 23 members appointed by the President, Speaker of the House, House minority leader, Senate majority leader, and Senate minority leader. Voting members include 7 appointed by the President and 3 by each congressional leader, while nonvoting members include 1 appointed by each congressional leader. The Commission to Study the Potential Creation of a National Museum of American Latino Heritage appoints 1 nonvoting member who must have expertise in various areas related to American Latino life, art, history, and culture. The Commission appoints a nonvoting member with expertise in public service or museum administration related to ethnic, racial, or cultural groups in American history. The Commission appoints a nonvoting member with expertise in public service or museum administration related to ethnic, racial, or cultural groups in American history. SEC. 3. FUNCTIONS OF THE COMMISSION. The Commission will submit a report to the President and Congress with recommendations for establishing and maintaining a National Museum of American Latino Heritage in Washington, DC. They will develop fundraising plans for the Museum and examine issues related to the availability and cost of collections for the Museum. The Commission will submit a report with recommendations for establishing a National Museum of American Latino Heritage in Washington, DC. The report will cover the impact on regional Hispanic- and Latino-related museums, possible locations, governance structure, community engagement, and cost considerations. Legislation will be proposed to implement the plan of action. The Commission will submit recommendations for creating a legislative plan to establish a National Museum of American Latino Heritage in Washington, DC. They may also convene a national conference on the Museum within 18 months of selecting commission members. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS. The Department of the Interior provides administrative services, facilities, and funds for the Commission's functions. Members receive compensation and travel expenses. The Commission is not subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The Commission must submit final reports and plans within 24 months of its first meeting and terminate within 30 days of submission. $2.1 million is authorized for the first fiscal year, and $1.1 million for the second fiscal year.
